He must be assigned counsel after the determination has been made that he is indigent, but he must be advised of his right --

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: And how can you make that determination till you get him before the Court?

turn.speaker: jane_e_bloom
turn.label: Ms. Jane E. Bloom
turn.text: It can’t be done and I don’t suggest that it needs to be.

I’m suggesting that the assignment of counsel or the advising of an individual of his right to assign counsel must occur when the writ of attachment -- after the writ of attachment has issued and the individual is physically before the judge.

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: And he says “I’m indigent.”
Now, he doesn’t really need a lawyer, because the judge is going to turn him free.

turn.speaker: jane_e_bloom
turn.label: Ms. Jane E. Bloom
turn.text: Well, unless the creditor has further need for information that --

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: Seems to me that the need for counsel vanishes at the same time that it arises.

turn.speaker: jane_e_bloom
turn.label: Ms. Jane E. Bloom
turn.text: Not necessarily.
I’ve enumerated in my brief a listing of perhaps 10 defenses that can be raised to a civil contempt action.
And these are all complicated defenses that one would need an attorney to assert.

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: But Ms. Bloom, the only way you get a lawyer appointed for you is because you’re indigent.

turn.speaker: jane_e_bloom
turn.label: Ms. Jane E. Bloom
turn.text: That’s correct.

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: And if you’re indigent, you have a complete defense.

turn.speaker: jane_e_bloom
turn.label: Ms. Jane E. Bloom
turn.text: Not necessarily.

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: You don’t need these other ten defenses now.

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: You don’t need any of these other defenses.

turn.speaker: jane_e_bloom
turn.label: Ms. Jane E. Bloom
turn.text: Not necessarily.

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: And by indigency do you become eligible for the appointment of a lawyer.

turn.speaker: jane_e_bloom
turn.label: Ms. Jane E. Bloom
turn.text: You might not which would show that in many cases, the appointment of a lawyer is not going to be needed, but it will also ensure that the individual who does not need the appointment of a lawyer is advised that he has a right to a lawyer.
In these defenses, particularly in the support and alimony area, defenses as such as the divorce decree was a foreign decree.
The divorce decree is ambiguous.
These are the kinds of things that maybe raised which I --

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: Which are not before us?

turn.speaker: jane_e_bloom
turn.label: Ms. Jane E. Bloom
turn.text: Well, these are -- there was a support and alimony individual in Rabasco and he might have been able to assert some of these defenses to the proceeding.

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: Ms. Bloom, I’m afraid we haven’t given you much of an opportunity to make your own arguments, but may I ask you one other question?

turn.speaker: jane_e_bloom
turn.label: Ms. Jane E. Bloom
turn.text: Sure.

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: I’m interested in the effect of the order.

Assume for the moment that we affirm the decision of the District Court, the order applies to all persons that in the limitation as to time who have been subjected to this procedure in the past to go back to 1906, I suppose if anybody is still alive.
What remedy would they have in a practical matter?

turn.speaker: jane_e_bloom
turn.label: Ms. Jane E. Bloom
turn.text: Well, I read the order differently.
I read the order in light of the opinion.
The opinion clearly states that the Court has enjoined further application of these statutes.
And I believe that very clearly means that it does not have retroactive effect.

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: That is not what the orders says, isn't it?

turn.speaker: jane_e_bloom
turn.label: Ms. Jane E. Bloom
turn.text: No, it is not, but I believe that it can only logically be read in light of the decision.

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: Thank you Ms. Bloom.
Thank you counsel.
The case is submitted.
